popt4jlib.MSSC1D

Class ClusterSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MSSC1D.ClusterSet

  • public class ClusterSet
extends java.lang.Object
    class represents a solution to an MSSC1D problem, by holding a list of the resulting Cluster object-indices. Not a thread-safe class as it is not intended for use from multiple-threads.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCluster(Cluster c)
      add the Cluster given in the input argument as an extra cluster in this ClusterSet but first checks to ensure that the smallest value in c is the successor of the greatest number contained in the ClusterSet (remember that ClusterSet objects hold integer index values to the sequence they are clustering).
      void addClusterNoCheck(Cluster c)
      add the Cluster given in the input argument as an extra cluster in this ClusterSet without doing any consistency check.
      void addClustersRight(ClusterSet cs)
      add the clusters in the input ClusterSet argument to (the right of) this ClusterSet object by calling the method addCluster(c) for each of the clusters of cs.
      double evaluate(Params p)
      evaluate the clustering represented by this object according to the data and parameters specified in the input Params argument.
      double evaluate(Params p, boolean allow_partial)
      evaluate the clustering represented by this object according to the data and parameters specified in the input Params argument p, allowing partial evaluation if the second argument is true.
      Cluster getCluster(int startind, int endind)
      return the Cluster object that starts with startind and ends with endind.
      (package private) java.util.Vector getClusters() 
      int getLastIndex()
      return the largest integer value held in any of the clusters in this ClusterSet object.
      java.util.Set getSetsStartingWith(int m)
      slower method implementing the same functionality of getSetsStartingWithFast(m).
      java.util.Set getSetsStartingWithFast(int m)
      returns all Cluster objects in this ClusterSet containing numbers having as min value the specified input m.
      private void initCache() 
      int size()
      return the number of clusters in this ClusterSet object.
      java.lang.String toString(Params p)
      return a String representation of this ClusterSet as follows: [(val_1,...val_i),...(val_j,...val_n)] where the vals are the real values of the data sequence in p.
      private void updateCache(Cluster c)

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        return the number of clusters in this ClusterSet object.
        Returns:
        int

      • addClusterNoCheck

        public void addClusterNoCheck(Cluster c)
        add the Cluster given in the input argument as an extra cluster in this ClusterSet without doing any consistency check.
        Parameters:
        c - Cluster

      • addCluster

        public void addCluster(Cluster c)
                throws CException
        add the Cluster given in the input argument as an extra cluster in this ClusterSet but first checks to ensure that the smallest value in c is the successor of the greatest number contained in the ClusterSet (remember that ClusterSet objects hold integer index values to the sequence they are clustering).
        Parameters:
        c - Cluster
        Throws:
        CException - if the consistency check fails

      • addClustersRight

        public void addClustersRight(ClusterSet cs)
                      throws CException
        add the clusters in the input ClusterSet argument to (the right of) this ClusterSet object by calling the method addCluster(c) for each of the clusters of cs.
        Parameters:
        cs - ClusterSet
        Throws:
        CException - if the consistency check fails when adding the clusters

      • getSetsStartingWithFast

        public java.util.Set getSetsStartingWithFast(int m)
        returns all Cluster objects in this ClusterSet containing numbers having as min value the specified input m. Normally, there will be just one such cluster, but there are cases when a ClusterSet holds not just a partition of the sequence indices but a large covering of the sequence, in which case the multiple-result-set is needed.
        Parameters:
        m - int
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Cluster>

      • getSetsStartingWith

        public java.util.Set getSetsStartingWith(int m)
        slower method implementing the same functionality of getSetsStartingWithFast(m).
        Parameters:
        m - int
        Returns:
        Set // Set<Cluster>

      • getCluster

        public Cluster getCluster(int startind,
                          int endind)
                   throws CException
        return the Cluster object that starts with startind and ends with endind.
        Parameters:
        startind - int
        endind - int
        Returns:
        Cluster
        Throws:
        CException - if no such Cluster exists in this ClusterSet object.

      • getLastIndex

        public int getLastIndex()
        return the largest integer value held in any of the clusters in this ClusterSet object.
        Returns:
        int

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(Params p)
        evaluate the clustering represented by this object according to the data and parameters specified in the input Params argument.
        Parameters:
        p - Params
        Returns:
        double will be Double.MAX_VALUE if this cluster-set doesn't contain all the indices of the data sequence in p.

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(Params p,
                       boolean allow_partial)
        evaluate the clustering represented by this object according to the data and parameters specified in the input Params argument p, allowing partial evaluation if the second argument is true.
        Parameters:
        p - Params
        allow_partial - boolean if true, the value returned is the sum of distances from center of the clusters contained in this ClusterSet, even if the ClusterSet is not a complete partitioning of the data sequence described in p
        Returns:
        double will be Double.MAX_VALUE if this ClusterSet does not represent a complete partition of the data sequence in p and allow_partial is false, or if any of the clusters in this ClusterSet violates the max. sum-of-intra-distances threshold constraint specified in p

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(Params p)
        return a String representation of this ClusterSet as follows: [(val_1,...val_i),...(val_j,...val_n)] where the vals are the real values of the data sequence in p.
        Parameters:
        p - Params
        Returns:
        String
